pageContext.title: Portrait of a Young Woman, called Mrs Cam of Newport, Gloucestershire
pageContext.description_physical:
UV image: loss of colours are evident in the lower part of the miniature, which appears white as the parchment and does not show the orange UV colour typical of lead white, used for the dress. Other retouched areas are evident on the background, at the top and right side.
The calcium and lead MA-XRF maps show a possible change in the length of the hair.
pageContext.pigments_costume: Dress: lead white dress; red flowers: red lead covered by a red lake; blue stems: indigo; green stems: copper-based pigment, yellow dye; green leaves: indigo and brochantite
pageContext.pigments_flesh_tones_and_lips: Skin: lead white, vermilion(?), red lead(?); lips: vermilion, red lake
pageContext.pigments_hair_and_beard: Hair: earth and umber pigments, lead-based pigment, carbon black, lead tin yellow, copper-based pigment
pageContext.Credit: The Thomson Collection at the Art Gallery of Ontario
